paragraphs.text: Hailing from Rennes, France, Remy holds a master’s degree in food science from the University of Montpellier. His desire to make wine took him to Marlborough, New Zealand, France’s Northern Rhone region, Victoria, Australia and California’s Napa Valley.

Atlas Wine Company was founded in 2012 as a new-generation farming company with more than 100 years of combined expertise developing and farming world-class vineyards and providing high-quality grapes to more than 250 wineries.
After reaching optimal ripeness, the Chardonnay clusters were harvested and gently pressed to preserve their aromatics. The juice was fermented 90% in barrels to enhance richness.

Elegance, finesse and power are three words that come to mind when tasting Oro Bello. The subtle nuances evoke a feeling of warmth. Fruit aromas range from pineapple to kiwi with Meyer lemon notes. The mouthfeel is smooth yet fresh and balanced with well-integrated toasted oak.

Oro Bello tastes best when shared with friends. Gather some of your loved ones for a feast of homemade guacamole with fresh salsa and grilled garlic/lime barbecued prawns. This wine pairs nicely with arugula salad, scallops, asparagus and risotto. For dessert, lemon meringue pie makes a great compliment for guests who love sweets almost as much as they love Oro Bello Chardonnay.
